Archive 5 [i](As this enters, shuffle the top five cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)[/i]
You may play the top card of the archived library.
You can’t play cards from your hand.

cards.special_text:
[+1]: Draw two cards. At the beginning of your next end step, discard your hand.
[-3]: You get an emblem with “At the beginning of your upkeep, put a loyalty counter on each Aerida planeswalker you control.”
[-5]: Take an extra turn after this one.
cards.notes:
!aerida

Homeplane: Arcanum
Gender: Female
Age: 231

Bio: A native of the plane of Arcanum, Aerida was a gifted prodigy in the academies. The one that came along one in a century, if not longer, as the academic elite were prone to telling her. Not to mention that her planeswalker status gave her a vaulted position in a world obsessed with learning more about how planes work. During her youth, she became close friends with another planeswalker: Felice. A walker from another plane who was just as much a prodigy as Aerida. And over time, that began to chaff on Aerida; the idea that she wasn't as special as she had thought. Jealousy began to grow, and truly flared when Felice discovered a method of achieving immortality, refused to share the secret, and then left. Aerida followed, after discovering a way to manipulate time to similarly drastically expand her lifespan, and in her jealousy orchestrated a plot that resulted in the death of Felice; effectively dooming the entire plane of Adira in the process.

Design Philosophy: Aerida is a creature of ego and intellect. To simply win is not enough; her victory must demonstrate her raw superiority. Her abilities should reflect this through abilities that require build-around and/orplay-around, and should also feel like a self-contained combo card.

cards.rules_text:
Each player can’t cast more than one spell until the start of your next turn.
Return each permanent card put into your graveyard from the battlefield since the end of your last turn to the battlefield tapped.
cards.special_text:
[+2]: Each player can cast only one more spell until your next turn.
[-3]: Exile all other permanents, then return them to the battlefield tapped under their owner’s control. Creatures can’t attack you or planeswalkers you control until your next turn.
[-8]: Return all permanent cards from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
cards.notes:
!felice fluffy: -the start of in +2, each—>all in—>from in ult

Homeplane: Adira
Gender: Female
Age: 234

Bio: Felice's homeplane of Adira was slowly collapsing. In an attempt to save it, Felice went to the plane of Arcanum to study to try and find a way to fix it. Eventually she found something that might work - a method for immortality that she hoped to apply on a much larger scale - and went back to Adira. The solution was the pump the plane with so much stabilizing white mana that it stopped collapsing, and had the side effect of all but removing death from the plane. But it was a brittle fix, and as the strain on the fix increased so did the amount of mana necessary, until eventually even time on Adira (compared to the rest of the multiverse) slowed down. And so over the course of two centuries years normal time, Felice herself experience several thousand years, albeit in a fugue state. When Aerida supposedly killed Felice, the spell/fix broke, and all that pent up strain started tearing Adira apart faster than ever. Felice, however, survived, and after recovering, sought out Arcanum once more in search for another way to save her plane.

Design Philosophy: Much of Felice’s powers and ideals revolve around the idea of stabilization. In addition, a major theme of cheating death and immortality. Permanent reanimation is one of her hallmarks, in addition to general control elements.
